block.p: Webs at the ends of branches on a variety of trees signal the presence of fall webworms. Since these pests feed just before leaf drop, they have little impact on a tree's overall health: prune out nests to aid appearance -- unless you prefer a Halloween effect.
If your peaches were ruined by brown rot this summer, remove the remaining fruit: the fungus that causes the disease will winter over on mummified fruit and reinfect the tree next year.

Webs at the ends of branches on a variety of trees signal the presence of fall webworms. Since these pests feed just before leaf drop, they have little impact on a tree's overall health: prune out nests to aid appearance -- unless you prefer a Halloween effect.
If your peaches were ruined by brown rot this summer, remove the remaining fruit: the fungus that causes the disease will winter over on mummified fruit and reinfect the tree next year.

Do not disturb tender summer-flowering bulbs or tuberous plants like cannas and dahlias until foliage is blackened by frost. It's a good time to decide how many of these tender plants you will overwinter, and to find storage places where they will be protected from freezing.
